noun.description: The most successful point; the culmination.
examples: he had reached the pinnacle of his career

noun.description: A high, pointed piece of rock.

verb.description: Set on or as if on a pinnacle.
examples: a rustic cross was pinnacled upon the makeshift altar

verb.description: Form the culminating point or example of.

origin: Middle English: from Old French, from late Latin pinnaculum, diminutive of pinna wing, point.
